refsect2.title: itdb_get_control_dir ()
refsect2.para: Get the i*_Control directory. Observed values are 'iPod_Control' for standard iPods and 'iTunes/iTunes_Control' for mobile applications.

listitem.simpara: the iPod mountpoint
path to the control dir or NULL of non-existent. Must g_free() after use.

refsect2.title: itdb_get_itunes_dir ()
refsect2.para: Retrieve the iTunes directory (containing the iTunesDB) by first calling itdb_get_control_dir() and then adding 'iTunes'

listitem.simpara: the iPod mountpoint
path to the iTunes directory or NULL of non-existent. Must g_free() after use.

refsect2.title: itdb_resolve_path ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar* itdb_resolve_path (const gchar *root, const gchar * const *components);
refsect2.para: We start by assuming that the ipod mount point exists. Then, for each component c of track->ipod_path, we try to find an entry d in good_path that is case-insensitively equal to c. If we find d, we append d to good_path and make the result the new good_path. Otherwise, we quit and return NULL.

listitem.simpara: in local encoding
in utf8

refsect2.title: itdb_shuffle_write ()
refsect2.para: Write out an iTunesSD for the Shuffle. First reassigns unique IDs to all tracks. An existing "Play Counts" file is renamed to "Play Counts.bak" if the export was successful. An existing "OTGPlaylistInfo" file is removed if the export was successful. itdb->mountpoint must point to the mount point of the iPod, e.g. "/mnt/ipod" and be in local encoding.

listitem.simpara: the Itdb_iTunesDB to write to disk
return location for a GError or NULL
TRUE on success, FALSE on error, in which case error is set accordingly.

refsect2.title: itdb_parse_file ()
refsect2.para: Same as itunesdb_parse(), but filename is specified directly.

listitem.simpara: path to a file in iTunesDB format
return location for a GError or NULL

a newly allocated Itdb_iTunesDB struct holding the tracks and the playlists present on the iPod at mp, NULL if mp isn't an iPod mount point. If non-NULL, the Itdb_iTunesDB is to be freed with itdb_free() when it's no longer needed

refsect2.title: itdb_write_file ()
refsect2.para: Write the content of itdb to filename. If filename is NULL, it attempts to write to itdb->filename.

listitem.simpara: the Itdb_iTunesDB to save

return location for a GError or NULL
TRUE if all went well, FALSE otherwise
